items.title: Safari getting lazy loading image support
items.content:
Frontend Focus

Brendan Kenny

Powerful Terminal and Command-Line (CLI) Tools for Modern Web Development ‚Äî What‚Äôs your favorite command-line tool? In this post, Louis shares a collection of relevant command-line apps and utilities that he has personally come across in the past few¬†years.

Louis Lazaris

Video API Built to Create Stunning Visual Experiences ‚Äî Are videos impacting your page's load time? Now, deliver optimized videos in the right format, quality & size based on the user's device in real-time. Delivering stunning visual experiences just got simpler, Try ImageKit's forever-free plan¬†today.

ImageKit.io sponsor

Release Notes for Safari Technology Preview 135 ‚Äî Here are the release notes for the latest preview build of Safari, which is available now. Most notably this version adds lazy loading image support, along with support for accent-color, the requestVideoFrameCallback API, and new viewport units.

Jon Davis (Apple)

Using Position Sticky with CSS Grid ‚Äî Explains how the default CSS grid stretch behavior affects position: sticky, and how to override it to make it work as¬†expected.

Ahmad Shadeed

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Version 96 of Chrome is rolling out now, so here's what's new in DevTools.
  • You can now download Firefox directly from the Windows Store.
  • Chris Siebenmann details how both Edge and Chrome may start restricting requests to private networks in order to resolve a security threat.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Using Web Workers to Boost Third-Party Script Performance ‚Äî A look at Partytown, a new experimental library that aims to improve third-party script performance using Web Worker¬†technology.

Arek Nawo

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Responsive Navbar Tutorial using HTML, CSS & JS ‚Äî I‚Äôve always found creating navigation components a bit of a pain so any pointers or help is always¬†welcome.

Kevin Powell

Put the ‚ÄúFlow‚Äù in Your Workflows with Shortcut ‚Äî Looking for an intuitive white-board style project management tool? Collaboration has never been easier with¬†Shortcut.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Why Your Website Should Not Use Dithered Images ‚Äî ‚ÄúDespite claims that dithered images will reduce your image‚Äôs file size, there are much better ways to compress your website‚Äôs¬†images‚Äù. Once upon a time, color depth limitations on displays made dithering desirable, but this is rarely the case¬†anymore.

Austin Carr

Your CSS is an Interface ‚Äî How human-friendly CSS class names can help someone use your website or web¬†app.

Eric Bailey

‚ÄúAMP Has Irreparably Damaged Publishers‚Äô Trust in Google-led Initiatives‚Äù
Sarah Gooding opinion

Generate a Pull Request of Static Content with a Simple HTML Form
Hilman Ramadhan

Jobs

Frontend Developer at X-Team (Remote) ‚Äî Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, and¬†more.
X-Team

Grow a Design System at Addepar ‚Äî Work with a talented team of designers and engineers on the foundation for Addepar‚Äôs expanding UX. We‚Äôre building tools that keep our customer experience one of the best in¬†Fintech.
Addepar

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Splide: Lightweight and Accessible Slider/Carousel ‚Äî It‚Äôs nice to see a clean, modern spin on the often maligned UI element. The homepage is packed with demos too. No dependencies, written in TypeScript, and boasts a clean report from Lighthouse. GitHub¬†repo.

Naotoshi Fujita

CSS Shadow Palette Generator ‚Äî A tool to help you create lush, realistic shadows in CSS. box-shadow can look fantastic, but can require a bunch of crafty tricks. This tool builds those tricks in, and makes them easy to¬†use.

John W. Comeau

Visualize Your IoT Data with Highcharts and InfluxDB

InfluxData sponsor

couleur.io: A Simple Tool to Build Harmonious Color Palettes ‚Äî Based on HSL color values and it spits out a palette of 10 color values of varying lightness levels but using a common hue and saturation level, thus the palette is¬†‚Äòharmonized‚Äô.

couleur.io

IconKitchen: Mobile App Icon Generator ‚Äî An interactive UI to customize your app icon with clipart, text, custom image, plus various settings for icon type, color, gradient, padding, etc., before downloading a ZIP¬†file.

Roman Nurik

TuiCss: A Text-Based User Interface CSS Library ‚Äî If you‚Äôre old enough to remember what DOS apps looked like (or, arguably, some Linux shell ones, even now) this may appeal to you. Get Borland Turbo Vision-esque visuals but on the web with¬†this. Is it a good idea? Less¬†sure.

Vinicius Reif Biavatti

Vant: 65+ Mobile UI Components Built with Vue & TypeScript

items.title: The highlights from Chrome Dev Summit
items.content:
üëã Hey folks. The Chrome Dev Summit took place last week, as such a fair few of the items this week link to news / articles off the back of that. Thanks for reading!
__
Chris Brandrick, your editor

Frontend Focus

#‚Äã516 ‚Äî November 10, 2021 | Read on the web

Everything Announced at Chrome Dev Summit 2021 ‚Äî A roundup of all the key announcements from the 2021 Chrome Dev Summit, with the links you need to find out¬†more. Una Kravets has a succint five-minute recap video here if you'd prefer that.

  • There's a new Lighthouse API to measure performance and best practices throughout a user flow.
  • An updated version of PageSpeed Insights is on the way, this post looks at what's new.
  • The Chrome Speed Metrics Team are seeking feedback on plans to measure responsiveness on the web.
  • This post highlights recent progress made towards an animation smoothness metric.
  • Richard MacManus of The New Stack shares his thoughts on Google‚Äôs Chrome Dev¬†Summit, calling it a 'web evolution, not¬†revolution'.

Rachel Andrew

The Browser Wars ‚Äî Jay‚Äôs excellent long-running Web History series returns, this time with a focus on the fierce browser wars of the late 90s amongst the likes of Microsoft, Netscape, and¬†Mozilla.

Jay Hoffmann

Implementing Batch Editing in an Angular Data Grid the Easy Way ‚Äî Use this tutorial to learn how to use Kendo UI for Angular to create a Data Grid that allows updates and saves in¬†bulk.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

Chrome's New Feature to Record and Replay User Flows ‚Äî It‚Äôs only a preview feature in Canary builds right now, but Chrome is adding a new Recorder panel to its DevTools which lets you record and replay a string of actions on a page (including under simulated slow network conditions). You can also measure the flow and get a performance trace for¬†analysis. Minko Gechev shared a video of it in action over on Twiter.

Jecelyn Yeen (Google)

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • The W3C's Annual Conference also took place last month over five days, and now the full archive of all the breakout sessions is online, complete with slides and video. You're bound to find something worth watching here ‚Äî¬†I just got done with Uchi Uchibeke's talk on the Web Monetization API.
  • Dev browser Polypane just hit version 7 bringing with it a slew of new features ‚Äî¬†including a system-wide color picker, prefers-contrast emulation support and live editing of pseudo elements across all viewports.
  • The second alpha of Tailwind CSS version 3 is out if you fancy battle-testing it a bit before the final release.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

'We Analyzed 425,909 Favicons' ‚Äî An interesting bit of work here digging into the current favicon ecosystem by fetching and analysing the favicons of the top 100,000 websites. You can see a map of all the favicons fetched¬†here.

Adam, Nathan & Patrick

Eye-Tracking in Mobile UX Research ‚Äî Explores the latest trends in eye-tracking and how the methodology can be included in the UX researcher‚Äôs¬†toolbox.

Mariana Macedo

Put the ‚ÄúFlow‚Äù in Your Workflows with Shortcut ‚Äî Looking for an intuitive white-board style project management tool? Collaboration has never been easier with¬†Shortcut.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

How to Implement and Style the <dialog> Element ‚Äî An in-depth look at the native HTML dialog element, showing you how to implement a user-friendly, accessible version on your¬†site.

Christian Kozalla

First Steps with GPT-3 for Frontend Developers ‚Äî Consider this a beginners guide to OpenAI‚Äôs API, easing frontend devs into the world of GPT-3 and giving you a heads-up on all the tools needed to start building AI-powered¬†apps.

Maxime Heckel

A Beginner's Guide to Responsive Images ‚Äî Includes live demos and code snippets introducing syntax for the srcset and sizes attributes and the <picture> element, for developers getting started with responsive¬†images.

Louis Lazaris beginner

Creating the Effect of Transparent Glass and Plastic with Three.js ‚Äî The effects you can pull off in the browser nowadays continue to impress me as someone who grew up on 8-bit¬†graphics(!).

Kelly Milligan

Learn Responsive Design ‚Äî This course is an excellent primer exploring all contemporary aspects of responsive¬†design.

Jeremy Keith beginner

Favicons: How to Make Sure Browsers Only Download the SVG Version
Chris Coyier (via ≈†ime Vidas)

If HTML and ARIA Don‚Äôt Allow It, It‚Äôs Probably A Bad Idea
Martin Underhill

Optimizing Resource Loading with Priority Hints
Sohoni, Osmani, Meenan

Native CSS Nesting: What You Need to Know
Sarah Chima Atuonwu

An Introduction to PostCSS
Craig Buckler

Jobs

Senior Web Developer (Node/ReactJS) - Remote ‚Äî Millions get inspired and plan adventures with our apps. To help us make komoot.com the place to go to plan outdoor adventures, we‚Äôre looking for a one of a kind Web Developer to join our¬†team.
Komoot

[EU] JavaScript Developer, Preferably with React Knowledge ‚Äî New hires get a "buddy" who will guide you through the company, code and the process. Newest technologies, development possibilities and satisfaction¬†:)
LastMinute.com

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

ssshape: An SVG Blob/Organic Shape Generator with Extra Controls ‚Äî Choose a few random points, then this tool will generate a blob that you can adjust with numerous settings, then copy/export in SVG¬†format. Quite a decent variety of options/outputs here.

S√©bastien No√´l

Iconsax: 6000 Free Icons in Six Different Styles ‚Äî This huge collection of icons is available in multiple styles and design-friendly formats. There‚Äôs also a React version and an accompanying component framework for¬†Vue.

Lusaxweb

Automate Domains, DNS, and SSL Certificates with This Special Offer üëÄ

DNSimple sponsor

Compressio: An Open Source Image Compression Tool ‚Äî Another option for batch image optimization (JPG, PNG, GIF & SVG). Allows 10 images/50MB at a time and includes a quality slider and settings to toggle lossless compression and metadata¬†retention.

Choudhary Abdullah

MiniMasonry.js: Minimalist Dependancy Free Masonry Layout Library

Spope

items.title: Edge puts on a Tux
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã515 ‚Äî November 3, 2021 | Read on the web

Microsoft‚Äôs Edge Browser Now Stable on Linux ‚Äî After over a year in preview, the stable version of Edge for Linux is now available. Here's the official blog post from Microsoft covering the news. This release means Edge is now available on Windows, macOS, iOS, Android, and Linux.

Tom Warren

Web Performance Metrics Cheatsheet ‚Äî A succinct, handy summary of web performance metrics (such as Time to First Byte, Largest Contentful Paint, Time to Interactive, etc). Also available as a¬†PDF.

Ire Aderinokun

New Frontend Masters Course on CSS Grid & Flexbox ‚Äî Learn essential layout techniques for building responsive, beautiful web apps. Get hands-on practice using CSS Grid for two-dimensional, grid-based layouts and Flexbox for styling one-directional¬†flow.

Frontend Masters sponsor

How I Made Google‚Äôs Data Grid Scroll 10x Faster with One Line¬†of¬†CSS ‚Äî If you're not familiar with the idea of CSS containment (now widely supported by browsers) and how it can improve the efficiency of a layout, this might be an eye opener.

Johan Isaksson

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Developer Tools Secrets That Shouldn‚Äôt Be Secrets ‚Äî An Edge-focused look at console power tips, how to use browser developer tools outside the browser, and¬†more.

Christian Heilmann

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • Version 94 of Firefox is now available. Here are the notes for developers.
  • You can expect accessibility improvements, bug fixes and a re-implementation of Sass division functions in version 4.6.1 of Bootstrap.
  • WebAssembly Dynamic Tiering is ready to try in Chrome 96.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

CSS-ing Candy Ghost Buttons ‚Äî Highlights a technique for creating outlined buttons with CSS. They look simple enough, but there‚Äôs a few things worth taking into consideration to get them looking right. Ana outlines the¬†solutions.

Ana Tudor

Respecting Users‚Äô Motion Preferences ‚Äî The prefers-reduced-motion media query has excellent support in all modern browsers going back a couple of years. In this article, Michelle Barker explains why there‚Äôs no reason not to use it today to make your sites more¬†accessible.

Michelle Barker

Using CSS Variables for Reduced Motion on a Global Scale ‚Äî How to use CSS Variable and the prefers-reduced-motion media feature to remove or minimize animations and transitions on global¬†scale.

Silvestar Bistroviƒá

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Have Single-Page Apps 'Ruined' the Web? ‚Äî An excellent, and clear talk from the creator of frontend framework Svelte talking about the often-valid criticisms lodged towards single-page apps and how ‚Äòtransitional apps‚Äô may be a way¬†forward.

Rich Harris

‚ÄúWe talk about documents versus apps as though it were a dichotomy, but it's not, it's a spectrum. When we erase the stuff in the middle we do the web a great disservice. It's a medium that by its very nature resists definitional boundaries.‚Äù

___
Rich Harris

Put the ‚ÄúFlow‚Äù in Your Workflows with Shortcut ‚Äî Shortcut is fast and intuitive project management built for developers. Delight the scrum gods and try it¬†now.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

The Golden Ratio and User-Interface Design ‚Äî Although traditionally used in art and architecture, the golden ratio can be referenced to design aesthetically pleasing¬†interfaces.

Kelley Gordon

The Process of Building a CSS Framework ‚Äî A behind-the-scenes look at making a CSS framework (specifically CodyFrame) and a tutorial on how to build a website with¬†it.

Claudia Romano

Best Practices for Embedding Third-Party Web Widgets
Ravidu Perera

Render Images Based on the Dark or Light Theme of the Client Device
Amit Merchant

Jobs

Frontend Developer at X-Team (Remote) ‚Äî Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, and¬†more.
X-Team

Work From Anywhere in the World: Remote Sr. Front-End Engineer ‚Äî B2B SaaS company seeks engineers who love building interactive data apps, being a part of a global community, and great hot¬†sauce.
Chili Piper

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Coding Font: A 'Game' to Find Your New Favorite Code Font ‚Äî This is a fun idea. It throws over 25 popular developer-oriented fonts into a ‚Äòtournament‚Äô and you then pick your favorites until you‚Äôre left with a winner. (It was JetBrains Mono for¬†me.)

Typogram

Fontfacer ‚Äî Autogenerate CSS Font Rules from Font Files ‚Äî Takes your uploaded font files and generates a list of CSS font rules for you to copy and paste into your¬†codebase.

Peter White

Vizzu: A Library for Animated Data Visualizations and Data Stories ‚Äî Vizzu is a little different to most data visualization libraries in the sense that animating the visualizations and transforming between different visualization types is the key¬†focus.

Vizzu

Automate Domains, DNS, and SSL Certificates with This Special¬†Offer¬†üëÄ

items.title: Photoshop in the browser is now a reality.
items.content:
Frontend Focus

#‚Äã514 ‚Äî October 27, 2021 | Read on the web

A Deep Dive into object-fit and background‚Äësize in CSS ‚Äî Goes through just how object-fit and background-size work, when to use them, and why, along with some practical use cases and¬†recommendations.

Ahmad Shadeed

Photoshop's Journey to the Web ‚Äî Just the idea of running software as complex as Photoshop directly in the browser would have been hard to imagine even just a few years ago, but here we are: Thanks to new standardized web technologies, Adobe has now brought a public beta of Photoshop to the¬†web. This opens up a lot of potential not just for Adobe but anyone with lofty browser-based¬†ambitions.

Thomas Nattestad & Nabeel Al-Shamma

Walkthrough of an Easy Angular Data Grid with Examples ‚Äî You could write your own data grid, but why would you when this one already exists. See how easy it is to set up, bind data, group, sort, page, and more. Fiddle with the live samples or install it and try it for yourself, but don‚Äôt miss¬†it.

Progress Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

New HTTP Standards for Caching on the Modern Web ‚Äî Caching static content via a CDN or similar service is important, particularly for large sites, but can often be complicated and confusing. This post looks at new HTTP standards that are hoping to make this better, how they work, and why you should¬†care.

Tim Perry

The Start of a New Era for Responsive Web Design ‚Äî After designing for fixed screens, and then responsively, the author proposes we‚Äôre entering an era of ‚Äòcomponent driven‚Äô design.

Francois Brill

New WebKit Features in Safari 15 ‚Äî A look at the new features available with the release of Safari 15.1, including aspect-ratio, CSS Grid Inspector, ES6 Modules in Workers and ServiceWorkers, WebGL2 and¬†more.

Jen Simmons

‚ö°Ô∏è Quick bits:

  • The hugely valuable Wayback Machine project from the Internet Archive got started 20-years ago this week.
  • Reminder: The State of CSS survey for 2021 is now open and seeking your response.
  • New material has been added to Google's Learn CSS course, including how to take advantage of CSS properties like ::marker and list-style.
  • As Lea points out here, the web probably needs its own Emoji picker.
  • A smart Web developer created a fake VS Code-esque Web page to keep an eye on the cricket scores.

üìô Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Prevent Scroll Chaining with Overscroll Behaviour ‚Äî Looks at the overscroll-behavior CSS property, what problem it solves, how it works, and where we can use¬†it.

Ahmad Shadeed

Building a Multi-Select Component ‚Äî A foundational overview of how to build a responsive, adaptive, and accessible, multiselect component for sort and filter user¬†experiences.

Adam Argyle

How Not To Create a Menu Burger Button ‚Äî A collection of bad practices in HTML - looking at menu buttons patterns, copied from real¬†websites.

Manuel Matuzoviƒá

Why 'Outdated' jQuery Is Still the Dominant JavaScript Library ‚Äî jQuery is one of the longest running and most influential JavaScript libraries on the web. How has it stood the test of¬†time?

Richard MacManus

‚ÄúA staggering 78% of the top 1 million websites use jQuery in some way, according to BuiltWith.‚Äù

___
Richard MacManus

"Dark Mode" vs "Inverted" ‚Äî An approach to help clarify the difference between ‚Äúdark mode‚Äù and ‚Äúcomponents rendered on a dark background‚Äù within your design¬†system.

Brad Frost

Building An Effective Image Component ‚Äî An out-of-the-box solution to optimize images for Next.js. It optimizes loading, compression & responsiveness. Now with AVIF support in Next.js¬†12.

Sohoni, Erickson, Castle

Shortcut Puts the Agile in Agile and the ‚ÄúCan‚Äù in Kanban

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

In-Page Filtered Search with Vanilla JavaScript

Hilman Ramadhan

100 Bytes of CSS to Look Great Everywhere

Shaun Wang

Expandable Sections Within a CSS Grid

Kev Bonett

Jobs

Work From Anywhere in the World: Remote Sr. Front-End Engineer ‚Äî B2B SaaS company seeks engineers who love building interactive data apps, being a part of a global community, and great hot¬†sauce.
Chili Piper

Find Frontend Engineering Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free for¬†job-seekers.
Hired

üîß Code, Tools and Resources

Huetone: Use The LCH Color Space to Come Up with Predictable and Accessible Color Palettes ‚Äî The creator explains the tool in detail in this Twitter¬†thread.

alexey ardov

Box Shadow Generator: A Visual Tool to Generate Code for CSS Box Shadows ‚Äî You can choose from a gallery of predefined box shadow settings or create and customize your¬†own.

Andrei Surdu

Free Activity Feeds & Chat APIs for Qualifying Teams ‚Äî Unlock enterprise-grade features, functions, and UI components completely free for your startup or side project with the Maker Account from¬†Stream.

Stream sponsor

Blobity: Level Up Your Cursor Game ‚Äî This script and API lets you do all sorts of creative things with the user‚Äôs cursor, which the page itself demonstrates ‚Äî the demo is similar to how the cursor on iPad OS works. Note that it‚Äôs free for open-source projects¬†only.

Georgy Marchuk

Image Compressor: Compress & Optimize JPEG and PNG¬†Images ‚Äî Yet another option for doing manual image compression. This one lets you upload multiple images and includes optional tools for resizing, converting, and¬†mirroring.

NAZRUL ISLAM

üçì Do you work with the Jamstack (that's a JavaScript, API and Markup architecture stack)? If so, you may enjoy Brian Rinaldi's JAMstacked, it's a fortnightly round-up covering the growing and rapidly evolving Jamstack ecosystem. Here's a little taste of the sorts of things shared in the latest issue:

Want to give it a try?
Tap here to subscribe
  • Matt Biilmann of Netlify discusses some key concepts that will impact the future of Jamstack with folks like Evan You, Rich Harris and more - from the recent Jamstack Conf.
  • It's often assumed that Jamstack or a serverless architecture are basically one and the same. This post from Colby Fayock breaks down the difference and shows how both can be combined.
  • Raymond Camden looks at the upgrade experience for Eleventy 1.0 (still in beta).
